places_with_reviews.name: Shri Bhagwant Mandir
places_with_reviews.address: 6MMQ+M7J, Mangalwar Peth, Mangire Mala, Barshi, Maharashtra 413401, India

reviews.text:
Shri Bhagwant Mandir is a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, located in the town of Barshi in the Solapur district of Maharashtra, India. It is believed to be the only temple in India dedicated to Lord Vishnu in his form as Bhagwant.

The temple was built in 1245 AD in the Hemadpanthi style of architecture, which is characterized by its use of black stone and intricate carvings. The temple has four entrances, one from each of the four cardinal directions. The main entrance is located to the east.

The temple's sanctum sanctorum houses the idol of Lord Bhagwant, which is made of black stone. The idol is seated on a lotus pedestal and holds a conch shell, a discus, and a mace in his hands. Below his right hand is a carving of the devotee king Ambrish. On the back of the idol is a carving of Shri Lakshmi, the consort of Lord Vishnu. On the forehead of the idol is a carving of a Shivlinga, and on the chest is a carving of the footprints of Bhrigu Rishi, a sage who is said to have worshipped Lord Vishnu at this temple.

The temple is also a significant historical and cultural landmark. It is a reminder of the rich Hindu heritage of the region.

The temple is dedicated to the Bhagavat incarnation of Vishnu.
It is the only temple in India dedicated to the Bhagavat incarnation of Vishnu.
The temple is believed to have been built in the 11th century.
It is a beautiful Hemadpanthi temple built with stone and brick.
The temple faces east.
There are two Nandi statues at the entrance of the temple.
The sanctum sanctorum of the temple houses a wooden statue of Vishnu in his Bhagavat incarnation.
The statue is beautiful and attractive.
The exterior of the temple is also beautiful.
The walls of the temple are adorned with statues and sculptures of various deities.
The temple is a popular pilgrimage site.
Millions of devotees visit the temple every year.
The Bhagavat festival is celebrated at the temple every year during the period of Vaishakha Shukla Shashthi to Dwadashi.

If you found this review helpful, please consider liking, sharing, and following for more travel insights. Thank you for your support! 👍👍👍

Barshi

big temple complex. very nicely built up and maintained. Bhagwant ..Shri Vishnu mandir. very attractive and divine murty.  Shri Mahalakshmi devi is just on the reverse side of. Bhagwant murti. Its architectural marvel. They have fixed mirror to facilitate darshan od mahalakshmi devi.  bhakt Ambarish is sitting near Bhagwant paduka.
read the story. Bhagwant came and gave darshan on  Baras day hence  Barshi name of the town.
A pakhwaji who was offering prayers by playing veeena , requested us to have prasad at nearby. Its free. they give priority to outside visitors over the regular locals.
must visit.

Very beautiful and peaceful place in Barshi. Must visit.
Prsadalaya is nearby. So take that too. It's delicious.

The Bhagwant Mandir at Barshi is a temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. The unique feature of this temple being, Lord Vishnu is accompanied by Goddess Lakshmi but she is placed behind Lord Vishnu with their backs towards each other. One has to take her darshan from the tilted mirror placed near the idol.

The original temple construction is around early 13th century with the stucco shikhara and Woodwork sabhamandap being a later addition during the medieval times.

The temple has a huge prakara with a Shri Datta temple besides the main temple.
1245AD - very very old temple, absolutely well maintained and also renovated - devotees visit regularly. People apart from Barshi also visit, have faith and worship regularly. Clean & spacious.

places_with_reviews.name: SHREE UTTARESHWAR MANDIR

reviews.text:
Famous Shiva temple in Barshi Shri Uttareshwar Mahadev.
Mahatma Gandhi's ashes were immersed  here in holy kund.

Chintamani Mobile Barshi
Address nearby Pandey Chowk Bank of Baroda Devne Galli Barshi
All Mobile accessories wholesale and retail

One of most famous Shri Utreshvar maharaj minder of Lord shiva. It was built in the 18th centuries. One of the biggest temple in barshi. Many people visit here daliy for blessing of Lord shiva. In the month of June and July many varkari who travels to pandhrpur stay here for rest of day.
It's one of holy place of Lord Mahadeva. Ancient mandir. Very nice. In shravan decoration of flowers and aarti very nice.

A beautifully constructed Temple, need renovation, many legendary stories are related with this Temple.
Must visit the place.
